com.ericdaugherty.lib.service
Class JndiConfigurationService

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.ericdaugherty.lib.service.JndiConfigurationService
Direct Known Subclasses:
EjbConfigurationService, WebConfigurationService
public class JndiConfigurationService
extends java.lang.Object

This class provides access to information bound to a JNDI tree.

This class provides a nice front end to the code to query configuration parameters from a JNDI server. It also provides convenience methods to cast the values to their appropriate type.

Author:
Eric Daugherty (http://www.ericdaugherty.com/java/daughertylib)

Constructor Detail

JndiConfigurationService

public JndiConfigurationService()
                         throws ConfigurationException
Creates a new instance of the JndiConfigurationService and initializes the initial context to the root context.
Throws:
ConfigurationException - thrown if there are any errors initializing the service.

JndiConfigurationService

public JndiConfigurationService(java.lang.String context)
                         throws ConfigurationException
Creates a new instance of the JndiConfigurationService and initializes the initial context to the specified context. All queries will be relative to this context.
Parameters:
context - the initial context.
Throws:
ConfigurationException - thrown if there are any errors initializing the service.

getObject

public java.lang.Object getObject(java.lang.String entryName)
                           throws ConfigurationException
Looks up the entryName parameter and returns it as a Object.
Parameters:
entryName - the name of the configuration entry to lookup.
Returns:
Object value of the configuration entry.
Throws:
ConfigurationException - thrown if any errors occur performing this lookup.

buildContextProperties

public java.util.Properties buildContextProperties(java.lang.String context)
                                            throws ConfigurationException
This method takes a context name, and returns all the Entry Names/Values in a properties object.
Parameters:
context - the initial context to load the properties from. This method prepends the default context to this parameter, so the context parameter should start with the the portion after the default.
Returns:
a Properties object with all the environment entries for the specified context.
Throws:
ConfigurationException - occurs if there are any NamingExceptions thrown during the execution of this method.
